discourse_list.title: Fallback Interim Facilitator Selection Process - CES-001

content.content: Executive Summary This post lays out the process for the Fallback Selection of Interim Facilitator for Collateral Engineering Services (CES-001). This is being done according to MIP41c6. Please note this is the first time this procedure has been used and we will have to make many judgment calls that are detailed here. Ultimately, we are looking to find someone the elected facilitators of Maker support for filling the facilitator role for CES. Those interested in this Interim Facilitator role have 24 hours to confirm their intention in this thread. Anyone may volunteer themselves for consideration in the voting process. If an individual is nominated by someone else, we will ask them to confirm they are willing to accept the nomination. We will allow volunteers to propose themselves as co-interim facilitators if they wish. In this instance, they will be voted on as a single option. @Core-Facilitators please note, that per MIP41c6, in addition to any volunteer nominees, all facilitators will be considered. Out of respect for people’s autonomy, we will be allowing current facilitators to withdraw themselves from consideration in this thread for 24 hours. After this nomination process, we will have a 1 week-long vote between active facilitators to consider nominees. This will be done with a ranked-choice (IRV) format. If the IRV process results in a winner, that person will be ratified as interim facilitator effective immediately. Alternatively, if at least 10 facilitators have the same nomination as their first choice after 3 days, we will end the vote prematurely as no other candidate could win the vote.  Timeline  This post announces our intention. Nominations will be open until 21:00 UTC, tomorrow November 24th. Please keep in mind, multiple people can run under one ticket provided they have the consent of all parties. Facilitators will be automatically considered for the vote unless they revoke their nomination in this thread before that time. After 21:00 UTC on 2022-11-24, @Patrick_J and myself will reply to this thread with all nominations, and notify all active facilitators that the vote is on. Each facilitator will be assigned a codename in a joint Discord DM with Patrick and me. Here they will reply with their Ranked Choice votes (including all parties they would support for a role). As Facilitators DM their votes, Patrick and I will update a public spreadsheet showing the anonymized choices here. After 21:00 UTC on 2022-11-27, any nominee receiving 10 or more first-ranked votes will be automatically ratified. If no early termination takes place, voting will be finalized on 2022-12-01 at 21:00 UTC. If IRV produces a winner, that nominee will be immediately ratified. If there is no winner on 2022-12-01, we will be following the 2nd Fallback process, dictating that we repeat these steps but with a 48-hour vote.   Considerations MIP41 requires results for voting to be public. We believe by assigning codenames we can ensure the accuracy of Patrick and my reporting (anyone who has their vote recorded incorrectly can point out the impropriety) while making the process easy for facilitators to participate transparently. Since MIP41c6 says a “minimum quorum” may be used, we intend to use the results at the end of the week, regardless of how many votes have been submitted. The only consideration is if IRV returns a winner, which can only take place when over 50% of voters have listed support for a nominee. Finally, it would be ideal to decide before a full week of waiting. Since it is mathematically impossible for anyone else to win the vote if 10 facilitators list a nominee as their first choice, we will end the vote early (as mentioned above) if this condition is met after a reasonable campaign time, in this case, 3 days. We believe this timeline should result in some clarity for the DAO on a quick time scale, while still respecting that many facilitators might be at lower capacity due to holidays in the US.  Feedback Welcome and Encouraged If you have issues with the above please raise them ASAP. Once the voting starts we will not be changing our methodology, so please consider reading this ASAP @Recognized-Delegates.
content.GPT-summary: The post explains the process for selecting an interim facilitator for Collateral Engineering Services (CES-001) according to MIP41c6. The author invites interested individuals to confirm their intention to run for the role and outlines the timeline for the nomination and voting process. The post also addresses considerations and welcomes feedback.

3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None

content.content: I would like to formally withdraw myself from the list of interim facilitator candidates.

Personally—I’ll always believe that IRV format is just plain wonky. It’s inconsistent and I’ve never seen any real-world good results with such format.  Nowhere in the fallback decision process does it also state that IRV must be used—any reason why y’all are choosing to use this inefficient method?
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: image987×149 30.7 KB  Thanks for the feedback, Frank. We are trying to adhere to the MIP as written, which clearly states that IRV is the preferred voting method in the Fallback Decision Process. I have included a screenshot with a highlight for emphasis. For what it’s worth, I’m afraid I have to disagree with your pessimism about IRV as a voting method. Is it perfect? No, no voting system is. But it is used successfully by multiple electoral systems around the world.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: I mean, “The Failed Experiment of RCV”. — the proof is in the pudding

Interim Facilitator Ratification - CES-001 Governance       Can we nominate someone else?  Since Nikolaj decided he was not up to the task, I would like to propose @Retro.     Thank you for the nomination. I accept the nomination and the opportunity to lead CES. For consideration, I helped jumpstart and facilitate the CMOFF calls through July of this year in cooperation with CES (7 months). I also co-developed the Auditor Framework and have the governance knowledge required for the role. My priorities would be to re-enable the key resources at the Core Unit to deliver on their mandate and methodically guide the team to the best future state (wind down or other) for the DAO.

Nomination withdrawn.

I would like to add my support to this Nomination. Notwithstanding that none of the remaining CES members do not currently have contracts with the CES core unit - we met this morning and we are unanimously in support of @lollike. Furthermore, in good faith myself and my colleagues are prepared to continue working prior to finalization of this vote to deliver the commitments of CES Core Unit - under the assumption that we will be retroactively reimbursed for the services we are providing - by whoever is the new interim facilitator. Also, in good faith, as CES has lost or will lose imminently access to our infrastructure and services I personally have put my personal credit card up to reinstate and transfer these services for the team so that we can operate pending the outcome of the fallback voting process. Collectively the team has decided that until the new interim facilitator is in place we will not be accessing or utilizing any funds from the Operations wallet until a new facilitator is in place. I personally am committed to help @lollike in successfully performing the interim facilitator role.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: To echo @dbkcan’s message above, the CES team members have come together this morning as a holistic team, and we unanimously support @lollike’s nomination as our interim facilitator. We are in the process of assembling the tools to resume work as a team based on good faith. Members of this team have continued to work in our own capacity through the past week; we have relative confidence that we will deliver the next spells as originally planned. We ask for the good will and support from the Maker community, the core team facilitators, and all fellow members in other CUs. May the good spirit shine!

content.content: After much deliberation, I have decided not to pursue the role as interim facilitator for CES. My goal has never been to be a facilitator, rather I stepped up to ensure continuity. After some internal chats I think we have found a good solution to ensure an orderly transition of the Core Unit. I recommend that you vote for Retro, who can help the team through the transition to the Endgame. cc @GovAlpha-Core-Unit @Core-Facilitators
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party extending to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: We have sent our DM’s to facilitators and will be collecting votes here. Reminder that voting for @Core-Facilitators ends Thursday at 21:00 UTC, unless we are able to get over 10 1st-choice votes for a single candidate after Monday.  Please visit this thread for any updates.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I would like to formally withdraw myself from the list of interim facilitator candidates.

With over the required 10 1st-choice rankings, GovAlpha is pleased to welcome @Retro as Interim CES Facilitator. Effective immediately he will have all roles and powers granted to the CES Facilitator. You can check out the voting from @Core-Facilitators here.

Thank you for the warm welcome @prose11 and to the @Core-Facilitators for their display of confidence in me for the role. Below is the immediate work I’m focusing on to stabilize the CES Core Unit after their turbulent week and to ensure the DAO’s operations are not further impacted by this event. Should there be any other immediate concerns or priorities among the community, please direct any comments my way and they will be addressed accordingly. Immediate Actions:  Re-enable and stabilize CES resources and contributors. Obtain a clear understanding of work requirements, timelines and deliverables. Reconfigure CES’s multi-sigs to meet MakerDAO’s best practices, and review operational expenses. Begin planning for the future state of CES resources. Define the Interim Facilitator timeline

content.content: Retro:   Reconfigure CES’s multi-sigs to meet MakerDAO’s best practices, and review operational expenses.    CES Operational Wallet The CES Operational Wallet has been reconfigured to the following: Quorum: 2:3 (no change) Active Signers: @Retro, @juan, @dbkcan CES Auditor Wallet CES’s active MIP40 is approved with an Auditor Wallet setup. This reconfiguration honors the approved MIP40, and aims to enhance the auditing function of the MIP by utilizing the SES Auditing Framework & resources. The same reviewers for SES’s Auditor Wallet will be utilized, and reporting will move from the CES Github to SES’s Expense Dashboard. I am requesting the current CES Auditors @Nadia @marcandu @cmooney to complete the following reconfiguration:   Add the following wallets as signers:   SES Accountant Role (a nested 1:2 wallet with @retro & @Dracaena27  as signers) 0xA2A855Ac8D2a92e8A5a437690875261535c8320C   GovAlpha Auditor Role (a nested 1:2 wallet with @Patrick_J & @prose11 as signers) 0xDc85cE806d057f4E5425b1e211b78d5af2728Df3     Remove the old wallet signers & set the quorum to 2:2  0xEeF3026eF864C9398c008195E65d16D9cb42a512 0xc8E6c287F6c127AFE5e4CB30bC440607b44c35f8 0xf63EfEE2A663b04cB5a09De6E3EB910d8442131D 0x86f2c2f1A278EeBd92b16A69C4469731B4e3e5DF    Governance (MCD_PAUSE_PROXY 0xBE8E3e3618f7474F8cB1d074A26afFef007E98FB) will remain as a beneficiary on the CES Auditor Wallet ensuring Governance control over these funds as well. @Dracaena27 @prose11 @Patrick_J  Please confirm your support of being CES Auditors.
